result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J. Sikora

records.addlTxt:
1:03 PM/ RM 203.  Defendant Travis J. Sikora in court via zoom in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney John Zich in court for Travis J. Sikora.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. has filed a waiver of P.H. form. Atty Zich has reviewed waiver of P.H. form with Def. Court finds Def. has entered freely and voluntarily and finds probable cause to bind over for further proceedings. State is prepared to proceed to arraignment today and has filed information that mirrors the criminal complaint. Atty Zich would prefer to proceed to arraignment today. Atty Zich waives reading, reserves rights, enters plea of Not Guilty. Court receives Not Guilty plea. Bond continues
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

1:10 PM Defendant Travis J. Sikora appeared by video, in custody from Langlade County Jail.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Kelly Hays in court, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed atty. or represent self. Def. wants an attorney and will contact P.D. Court orders Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105 as a condition of his bond.  State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. is on a probation hold. Def. makes statement on bail/bond. Court reviews criminal complaint.  Court gives 3 factors for setting bond & orders $1,000  cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription & Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court goes over preliminary rights with defendant. Court heard on Nhia Lee.  Def. heard on rights and request preliminary hearing within 10 days.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
